He is applying for the loan to buy animals for slaughter, as there is lot of demand at this time of year. He is very happy about the opportunity he is receiving through Yehu and from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy animals for slaughter

loans.name: Main De Dieu 2 Group

texts.en:
Serge, age 32, is single and has an eight-year-old child. He also provides and cares for his grandmother. Serge is representing the Main de Dieu 2 (#1) group. Serge operates a video game room in his community. Game rooms in Congo are like mini arcades where customers pay to play on video game systems. This game room has been in operation for five months. He will use the loan to buy two more televisions for his business. His business strategy is to offer better prices than other game rooms. 

Serge has received three previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. He has a good repayment record. He hopes to one day have a large building and operate a large entertainment and games business.

loans.use: to pay for two televisions

loans.name: Bekim

texts.en:
Bekim is from Kosovo. He lives in the capital city Prishtina. He is married and he has three children, two of whom go to school. 

Bekim has been working as an auto mechanic for more than twelve years. He started his business in 2002 and is planning to expand his garage in the future. 

Bekim applied for a loan in order to by car oil and grease tools for his business. 

These items will help him a lot in improving his income, developing his business, and improving the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: To by car oil and grease tools for his business

loans.name: Prospère Birame

texts.fr: Prospère est un homme marié, père de trois enfants.Il tient une boutique de vente de produits cosmétiques au grand marché de sa localité.Son activité lui rapporte des bénéfices assez consistants qui lui permettent de prendre en charge ses propres besoins ainsi que les dépenses d'entretien de sa famille.Afin d'augmenter son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 400000f pour acheter des produits cosmétiques et des tissus.Son ambition est de se lancer dans le commerce en gros.
texts.en: Prospère Birame is a married man and the father of 3 children. He runs a shop selling beauty products at his local Grand Market. His business generates fairly consistent profits which allow him to take care of his own needs and to cover his family's living expenses. He is requesting a loan of 400 000 francs in order to increase his capital so that he can buy beauty products and fabric. His ambition is to get into the wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products and fabric.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: LA SEÑORA NANCY TIENE 33 AÑOS Y HA SIDO BENEFICIARIA DEL CRÉDITO EN DICIEMBRE DEL AÑO 2010 CON UN MIL DOSCIENTOS DOLARES NORTEAMERICANOS, LOS CUALES LE SIRVIERON PARA LA ADQUISICIÓN DE UN MOTOR NUEVO PARA UNA HERRAMIENTA DE TRABAJO QUE LE GENERABA UN INGRESO ADICIONAL QUE ES EL TAXI Y LA COMPRA DE UN EQUIPO DE GAS PARA LA MISMA MOVILIDAD QUE ABARATA LOS COSTOS DE GASOLINA QUE ES CARA EN NUESTRO PAÍS, EL EQUIPO Y MOTOR NUEVOS HAN SIDO UNA INVERSIÓN BENEFICIOSA PARA INGRESO DE RECURSOS EN LA PRESTACIÓN DE SERVICIOS DE LA SEÑORA NANCY, ACTUALMENTE HA TERMINADO DE CANCELAR EL CRÉDITO Y CON LOS RECURSOS OBTENIDOS  DEL TRABAJO DEL TAXI EN ESTE TIEMPO, HA PODIDO AHORRAR UN MONTO Y SE ESTÁ COMPRANDO UN LOTE DE LOS SUEGROS EN LA MAICA, (ELLA NO CUENTA TODAVÍA CON VIVIENDA PROPIA, VIVE EN LA CASA DE LOS PADRES ACTUALMENTE Y DESEA TENER UN ESPACIO PROPIO PARA LA FAMILIA),  PARA LO CUAL LE FALTAN RECURSOS PARA COMPLETAR LA COMPRA Y POR TAL MOTIVO ESTÁ SOLICITANDO UN SEGUNDO CRÉDITO QUE IRÁ A CUBRIR LO QUE LE FALTA PARA CONCRETAR LA COMPRA DEL LOTE Y ASÍ MEJORAR LAS CONDICIONES DE VIDA DE LA FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Ms. Nancy, 33, was the beneficiary of a December 2010 loan in which she received 1,000 US dollars which were useful to her in acquiring a new motor for a work tool which was generating additional income for her, that is, the taxi, and to purchase a natural gas system for the same vehicle which lowers her fuel costs since gasoline is expensive in our country. The new fuel system and motor have been a beneficial investment, providing a good return for Ms. Nancy's taxi service business. 

Currently she has finished paying off the loan and with the resources obtained from providing taxi services during this time, she has been able to save up a sum and is purchasing a plot of land from her in-laws in La Maica (she still does not have her own housing and currently lives in her parents' home, and wishes to have her own space for her family). They still lack resources to finalize the purchase and so she is seeking a second loan which will go to cover what she lacks to firm up the purchase of land, and so improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase land from her in-laws.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a married woman with six children, four of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past ten years, she has been operating a retail shop, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of high transportation costs in her business. She dreams of expanding to improve her living standards. 

With the 40,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. Her dream of having a wholesale remains in her mind even as she works extra hard to ensure that this dream comes true.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Haron

texts.en:
Haron is 47 years old, married, and blessed with six children that he supports. He has been a mixed farmer for the past seven years. His monthly income is 25,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). 

He is applying for his second loan of 25,000 KES from KADET; he plans to buy farm inputs and prepare his garden for growing crops. 

He intends to use the anticipated profits to support his business. His future dream is to have a stable business and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and pay for labour

loans.name: Bibi

texts.en:
Bibi is a cereal vendor. She is a very enterprising lady whose efforts have paid off through hard work. She tells us that her business is doing very well and that her aim is to have a cereal depot where she will supply cereals to a larger region.

She is now requesting a loan of Ksh 50,000 in order to buy a stock of maize to offer for sale. She has established a good clientele base and relates genuinely well with her customers. This has enabled her to increase her monthly income to about Ksh 8,000. 
 
Bibi is confident that the profits expected from this loan will help her to further expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of maize to offer for sale

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma operates a retail shop to earn a living. She has run her business for the past year and a half and works hard to meet her family's needs. Her husband is engaged in farming. They work together to maintain the family's expenses so that they can live in dignity.

Fatuma tells us that her business is doing very well and that she has managed to increase her monthly income by over 30 percent.

Fatuma is requesting her second loan in order to buy flour, sugar, rice, beans, and other items that she will make available to her customers. She gives thanks for the help that she is receiving from Kiva and Yehu, and she promises to fully invest it in her business so that it can expand.

Her dream is to own a wholesale business in future.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour, rice, sugar and cooking oil for her shop.

loans.name: Ramata

texts.fr: Ramata est une femme mariée.Elle est mère de six enfants dont les trois fréquentent l'école.Elle est une femme au foyer et s'occupe à longueur de journée des travaux ménagers. Elle pratique en même temps l'embouche ovine.Elle achète chaque année des moutons qu'elle engraisse et revend à bon prix.Les revenus générés par son activité lui permettent de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille. Elle sollicite en ce moment un pret de 100000f pour acheter 4 moutons.Elle ambitionne de se lancer dans l'embouche bovine.
texts.en: Ramata is a married woman. She is the mother of 6 children, 3 of whom go to school. She is a housewife and takes care of the household chores during the day. She also practices sheep-fattening. Each year, she buys sheep which she fattens and resells for a good price. The revenue generated by her business enables her to provide for herself and her family's needs. She is currently requesting a loan of 100 000 francs with which to buy 4 sheep. Her ambition is to engage in cattle-fattening.

loans.use: to buy 4 sheep.

loans.name: Ateme

texts.en:
Ateme operates a tailoring business. She has been a tailor for the past 12 years and makes tablecloths, curtains, skirts, and dresses for her local customers. Ateme genuinely enjoys her work. She lives in Kosovo with her husband and their four children. 

Hateme is requesting a loan through KosInvest to buy equipment for her sewing machine. 

Ateme has been sustaining her business through her own efforts and with the help of previous loans from KosInvest. She hopes to earn a higher income and to expand her business in the future. 

She is happy for the financial support from KosInvest because it helps her to secure a stable future for her family.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her sewing machine

loans.name: Sylejman

texts.en:
The borrower, Sylejman, lives in Kosovo. He is a widower and has three children.  He has been working as a taxi driver for more than four years. He will use this loan from KosInvest to repair his taxi.  

He hopes to increase his income after he repairs his vehicle. His dream is to better the living conditions for his family and provide better education for his children.

loans.use: To repair his taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase his shoe inventory

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, age 31, operates a barber shop to earn a living. He lives with his wife and their four children in the town of Kijura in the Hoima region of Uganda. Three of their children are currently enrolled in school. David has been working hard for the past nine years to manage his salon, where he offers phone-charging services in addition to cutting hair. 

To help expand his business, David has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase inventory and to perform necessary repairs. The profits expected from this loan will help David to generate greater profits and to build a house for his family. David hopes that in the future he will be able to buy a motorcycle. 

David is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like David who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to increase inventory and perform necessary repairs

loans.name: Maleo

texts.en:
Maleo is 39 years old, married to Simpai, and blessed with seven children who he supports. He is a wheat farmer and has been a farmer for the last 15 years, earning an income of KES 50,000 monthly. 

He is taking out his seventh loan of KES 90,000 from KADET that he will use to purchase fertilizers and pay for the spraying of pesticides for his wheat farm.

He intends to use the anticipated profits to support his business and provide for his family's basic needs. His dream is to increase his farm acreage and go large scale.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi, age 42, has been married to Salimu, a businessman, and they have three children.

Mwanamisi owns a motorcycle and she has hired an employee to operate it. It has been running for the last twelve months. Her employee operates in the rural area, but says that there are several motorcycles in this zone, and that the business activity is very competitive. However, her employee cannot miss his shift for even one day, not even with rain or cold.

She also recalls that there is a lot of insecurity. At times, the places where he takes his passengers are far away, dark, and uninhabited, and where he is endangered.

Her greatest desire is to own several motorbikes and also open a retail shop in the future. That way she will be able to fulfill her family obligations. 

She greatly values the opportunity offered by Yehu Microfinance and Kiva.

She is requesting the loan to buy spare parts and service the motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and service the motorcycle.

loans.name: Samedin

texts.en:
Samedin is a taxi driver. He lives with his wife and two children in Kosovo and works hard to support his family. Due to a lack of family income, he chose to work as a taxi driver because it is the only source of work which allows him to earn enough income to meet the family’s expenses. 

He believes he does well in his job because he is very responsible when he drives. He is charismatic and has good relationships with his customers.

Samedin is very happy to receive a loan from KosInvest because it will help him to repair the air conditioner in his vehicle and to reinforce the vehicle doors.

His goal is to have a safer vehicle for transporting his customers. He is confident that this will allow him to increase his income and thereby improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to repair the air conditioner in his taxi and to reinforce the vehicle doors

loans.name: Carlos Edgar

texts.es: Carlos, nuestro cliente, es un joven humilde y trabajador de 24 años de edad.  Vive en uno de los barrios más pobres de Cochabamba, a 20 minutos de la ciudad, en una zona muy peligrosa y de deficientes servicios públicos; sin  mbargo, él decidió cambiar de camino junto a sus hermanos,  pese a que cuando tenía 16 años su padre murió de un shock séptico y su  madre murió en un accidente automovilístico en 2004.  Ahora se dedica a tocar música mariachi, ya que desde niño tenía una afinidad y facilidad para la música.  Toca diversos instrumentos musicales, como la guitarra, el guitarrón, la trompeta, el violín y la biwela en diversos grupos de mariachis en la ciudad de Cochabamba y en el interior de Bolivia. El  junto a sus hermanos salieron adelante; ahora necesita de un equipo de sonido para poder tocar y ganar más ingresos, motivo por el cual solicita el presente crédito.
texts.en:
Carlos, a client of CIDRE, is a humble and hardworking young man who is 24 years of age. He lives in one of the poorest neighborhoods of Cochabamba, which is 20 minutes away from the city. This area is very dangerous and lacks public services. Nonetheless, Carlos and his siblings have decided to pursue a different path in life. When he was 16 years old, his father died of septic shock. His mother died in an automobile accident in 2004.

Carlos now plays in a mariachi band since he showed an affinity and talent for music at a young age. He plays different instruments such as the guitar, “guitarrón” (a folk guitar with 25 strings), trumpet, violin, and vihuela (another traditional stringed instrument) for various mariachi groups in the city of Cochabamba and in the heartland of Bolivia. Carlos and his siblings have been able to move forward. Now he needs sound equipment so that he can continue to play and generate more income. This is the reason why he is requesting this loan.

loans.use: to buy sound equipment.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 27 years old and lives in the town of Masindi in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has two children with one currently in school. For the past two years, Agnes has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells general goods. She also has a small clinic. 

To help expand her business, Agnes has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase the inventory of her business, and it will help Agnes to generate a greater profit. She hopes to make enough of a profit to complete her house. Agnes hopes that in the future she will be able to build her own commercial building so she does not have to rent. 

Agnes is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Agnes who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but they have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of her business

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 61 years old. He supports 10 people in his family. For the last seven years, he has been a maize farmer earning a monthly income of 20,000 KES. 

He is servicing his second loan of 50,000 KES from KADET LTD, which he intends to use to purchase farm inputs. The anticipated profits will be used to diversify into sheep keeping. 

His future dream is to improve his financial stability.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 44 years old and lives in the town of Kijura in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has eight children, five of whom currently attend school. For the past six years, John has been working hard to manage his bar, where he sells beer and soft drinks. 

To help expand his business, John has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase stock, and will help John to generate greater profits, boost his income, and buy a motorcycle. John hopes that in the future he will be able to expand and have another bar in town. 

John is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like John who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to increase his stock of beer and soft drinks

loans.name: Sonford

texts.en:
Sonford is 28 years old and married to Donner. They have been blessed with two children, ages 4 and 2. He sells kitchen utensils, a business he ventured in nine years ago. He earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES. 

He wants to purchase more utensils such as plates, cups, spoons, and sufurias (cooking pots) for resale. He has requested his first loan of 30,000 KES. The profit he makes from his business will help him to purchase additional inventory. His dream is to see his business prosper, as well as to bring up a happy family.

loans.use: To purchase more kitchen utensils such as plates, cups, spoons, and sufurias

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma, age 29, operates a food stall. She has run this business for over four years. She earns additional income from farming. She and her husband Mwadingo have three children. The eldest is 14 and the youngest is a one-and-a-half-year-old baby. The two older children are students who dream of someday becoming successful professionals. The family lives in a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.
 
Fatuma started out with a small amount of capital that she obtained from the sale of farm produce from her farming endeavors. She set up a food stall on one of the busiest and most well-known street corners of the trading center, which is opposite a private school. She was able to form a large customer base. 

She is a self-sacrificing person who has demonstrated that she can get ahead as a result of her work. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy meat, wheat, maize flour, rice, and other items with which to restock her stall, which will allow her to continue working and supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy meat, wheat, maize flour, rice, and other items to offer for sale

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a 35-year-old business owner who works selling charcoal. She tells us that she has had this business for three years, previously selling cereals in a store.

Her business is located in a strategic place in a trading centre at Mwambalazi, Kenya, where she has a great number of customers. 

Thanks to her work and her business, she has been able to help her family and give them all that they need for a dignified life.

She is requesting the loan to be able to stock her charcoal store with more sacks, as she has a lot of demand, especially this rainy season, and wants to have them in stock to be able to offer them to her customers. 

She thanks Yehu and Kiva for the opportunity that she is receiving.

loans.use: to stock her charcoal store with more sacks.

loans.name: Sanjor

texts.en:
Sanjor, age 38, runs a clothing business. She established this venture in 1990. She lives with her husband and their three children in Kulanda town in the Bo southern area of Sierra Leone. The children's ages are between 8 and 19 years old and all three currently attend school. Sanjor did not attend school. She has a strong understanding of operating her business. She works 11 hours a day six days per week. At present, she faces the obstacle of rapid inflation.

Sanjor requires a loan in order to buy more lace, silk, bamako material, and rubber. She is confident that the extra income from this loan will allow her to become an international businesswoman and will permit her to set aside enough money to educate her children. 

In the future, Sanjor plans to open a boutique. 

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more lace, silk, bamako material, and rubber

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel, age 40, has sold maize to earn a living for the past three years. He lives with his wife and three children in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda. Two of the children are currently enrolled in school. Joel has been working hard to manage his food business.

To help expand his business, Joel has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more inventory and will help Joel to generate greater profits and increase his overall stock. 

Joel's goal for the future is to be able to build rental houses. 

Joel is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joel who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more maize inventory

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is 29 years old and lives in the town of Masindi in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past four years, Ronald has been working hard to manage his motor shop, which deals in motor spares (new and second-hand), and he also does repairs. 

To help expand his business, Ronald has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase his stock, which will help Ronald generate a greater profit.  Ronald hopes that in the future he will be able to have a larger business and offer transportation services. 

Ronald is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ronald who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but they have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: To increase his stock

loans.name: Marcos Ramiro

texts.es:
Marcos Ramiro tiene 53 años de edad es casado tiene 1 hijo, vive con El hijo y la esposa en San Miguel provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la VRC PATRON SAN MIGUEL se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Paila Loma Cantón San Miguel, a una distancia de 40 minutos a la oficina de la Cooperativa San José Agencia Chillanes, los socios se dedican a la agricultura y crianza de animales.

Marcos Ramiro se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz fréjol, arveja, mora, además se dedica a la crianza de ganado cerdos, pollos.

Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para los cultivos además de fertilizantes, abonos Y ganado. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar LOS FERTILIZANTES Y ELganado para aumentar las crías y poder venderlos. Las compras lo hace en San Miguel.

El sueño es poder comprar terreno, ver profesionales a los hijos. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es el mal clima. En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte salir a pasear, visitar a la familia y disfrutar del las festividades del Patrón San Miguel.
texts.en:
Marcos Ramiro is 53 years old, married, and has one child. He lives with his wife and son in San Miguel, which is in Bolívar Province.

Marcos is a member of the Communal Bank “Patron San Miguel”, which is located in the community of Paila Loma in the canton of San Miguel. This community is 40 minutes away from the Chillanes branch office of Cooperativa San José. The members of this Communal Bank engage in agriculture and livestock breeding.

Marcos Ramiro is a farmer who grows corn, beans, peas, and blackberries. He also raises livestock, such as pigs and chickens. Marcos is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies for his crops, such as fertilizers and compost, as well as livestock. With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy fertilizers and livestock so that he can increase his output and continue to sell. His purchases are made in San Miguel.

Marcos dreams are to buy a plot of land and to see his son become a professional. The challenges he faces include dealing with bad weather.

In his free time Marcos enjoys practicing sports, going for walks, visiting with his family, and enjoying the patron saint festivals of San Miguel.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, and livestock.

loans.name: Tudumu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Namudumbi est une femme dynamique,  âgée de 48ans. Elle est membre du groupe de crédit Tudumu, mariée à un homme sans emploi  et  mère de 9enfants tous scolarisés.  Elle vendeuse des produits divers dont les bidons et les chaises artisanales et est au 3ème cycle de crédit de Hekima. Le crédit sollicité va lui servir à l’achat de 10 bidons vides et matières premières pour la fabrication des chaises. Son vœu  est de devenir grossiste à la longue; ainsi, elle remercie Hekima  pour ses actions.
texts.en: Namudumbi is a dynamic 48 year old woman. She is a member of the Tudumu borrowing group. She is married to an unemployed man and is mother to 9 children who all attend school. She is a trader of various products including cans and handcrafted chairs and this is her third loan cycle with the microfinance institution Hekima. She is seeking a loan in order to buy 10 empty cans and the primary materials needed to make chairs. Her long-term goal is to become a wholesaler. For this reason, she would like to thank Hekima for its support.

loans.use: to buy 10 empty cans and the primary materials needed to make chairs

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Emperatriz

texts.es:
La señorita Emperatriz es socia del banco comunal “Fruto Bendito” del Distrito de Manantay, Departamento De Ucayali,  tiene 21 años y es soltera.
Lleva un corto tiempo trabajando con los préstamos que le brinda Manuela  Ramos para su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza.
Con este nuevo crédito de s/ 1,200.00 nuevos soles, comprará: 2 perfumes para mujer, 3 labiales, 3 esmaltes de uñas, 1 desmaquillador,  2 rimer, 2 sombras, 1 perfume para varón, 1 loción para después de afeitar, 1 delineador, 2 cremas para manos, 1 rubor.
Está muy contenta con Manuela Ramos porque le ha dado la oportunidad de tener este pequeño negocio que el cual realiza en sus tiempos libres, lo mejor de todo es que tiene clientes fijos y no tiene ningún problema con sus pagos.
texts.en:
Srta. Emperatriz is a member of the Communal Bank “Fruto Bendito”, which is located in the District of Manantay in the Department of Ucayali. She is 21 years old and single.

Emperatriz has been working a short time with the loans provided by Manuela Ramos for her business. She sells beauty products.

With this new loan of 1,200 PEN she will buy two women’s perfumes, three lipsticks, three nail polishes, one makeup remover, two mascaras, two eye shadows, one men’s cologne, one aftershave lotion, one eye liner, two hand crèmes, and one blush.

Emperatriz is very pleased with Manuela Ramos because she has been given the opportunity to have a small business that she can manage in her free time. Best of all, she has established customers and is not experiencing any problems with her payments.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Afrim

texts.en:
Afrim is from Kosovo. He is married and is the father of three children, all of whom go to school. For the past three years, Afrim  has sold construction materials. He started working by himself but as his business expanded he has employed his brothers to help him. Afrim's work is very important to him as he is the only one in the family who has a job and is able to generate income.

Afrim is requesting a loan to buy a new cement machine and other supplies in order to keep on supplying his customers.

loans.use: to buy a new cement machine and other supplies

loans.name: Simbira Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mapendo femme  ambitieuse,  âgée de 32ans est  présidente de l’association d’affaire  simbira. Mère de 4enfants  tous scolarisés,  est mariée à un commerçant. Elle vendeuse des fretins depuis  2006  et  est  au 8ème cycle de crédit chez Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir à l’approvisionnement de 80 kilos des fretins. Son vouloir est de construire une maison d’habitation familiale. Sur ce, elle remercie Hekima pour ses actions en faveur de la femme pauvre à faible revenu.
texts.en: Mapendo is an ambitious 32 year old woman. She is the president of the Simbira business association. She has four children who are all in school and is married to a trader. She has been selling fish fry since 2006. This is her 8th loan cycle with Hekima. She is requesting this new loan in order to buy 80 kilos of fish fry. Her goal is to build a family home. For this, she would like to thank Hekima for helping poor low-paid women.

loans.use: to buy 80 kilos of fish fry

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Nuru Group

texts.fr: La cliente  Namegabe  femme  entrepreneur,  âgée de 50ans est  membre du groupe de crédit Nuru. Mère de  10 enfants  tous scolarisés  et mariée à un homme d’affaire.  Ce nouveau crédit  doit lui servir à l’approvisionnement de 30 paires de souliers.  Elle protège  construire une maison familiale. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima  et  prie Dieu de le bénir d’avantage.
texts.en: Namegabe is a 50 year old entrepeneur who is a member of the Nuru borrowing group. She is a mother to 10 children who are all in school and is married to a businessman. She is requesting this new loan in order to buy 30 pairs of shoes. She would like to build a family home. For this reason she would like to thank Hekima and pray to God for his blessing.

loans.use: to buy 30 pairs of shoes

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Sandra Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ofrecer un producto fresco y de buena calidad es el trabajo de doña Sandra, con sus cajas de pan, su silla a la par y todas las ganas de vender  todo su productos en el día, asi es como se gana la vida Sandra   una humilde habitante de León, de 56 años de edad, casada, madre de un hijo de 23 años de edad el cual  esta a su cargo debido a que necesita cuidados especiales, ella realizo estudios  hasta quinto grado de primaria pues su situación económica no le permitió culminar sus estudios. Ella inicio su negocio ayudándole a su mama ya que se dedicaba a la misma actividad, luego la mama fallece, queda a cargo del negocio Sandra, hoy en día cuenta con 22 años de experiencia y total dominio, en su negocio no tiene apoyo de nadie pues lo saca adelante por su sola, sus productos los comercializa en los alrededores de la comunidad. Su esposo es asalariado y aporta para los gastos del hogar como otros ingresos, ella tiene como expectativa  establecer su negocio en su casa de habitación para tener más tiempo para dedicarle a su hija. 
Solicita el crédito para comprar pan ya que es un producto que se vende bastante en la zona, Sandra estima que este préstamo será de ayuda porque podrá ofrecer a sus clientes variedad de productos con el objetivo de mejorar sus ingresos, sus planes futuros es crecer en productos variados para su negocio pues su deseo es seguir trabajando en la misma actividad  ya que es algo que le gusta hacer y con lo que ha podido salir adelante, sus metas próxima es llegar a ser una de las mejores comerciante de la comunidad para obtener mejores ingresos y  poder salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra's work is offering a fresh, high quality product, as she sits in her chair alongside her crates of bread hoping to sell all the products each day. This is how Sandra, a 56-year-old, married, modest resident of León and mother of a 23-year-old son, earns her living. She takes care of her son because he has special needs. She only attended school through 5th grade, as her financial situation didn't allow her to finish. 

She began her job by helping her mother, who was in the same business. When her mother died, Sandra became responsible for the business. She has 22 years of experience now and is fully qualified. She works alone and has no one else to help her manage. She sells her products on the outskirts of the community. Her husband is a salaried worker; his income covers some of the household expenses. Sandra would like to set up her shop at home so that she could spend more time with her daughter. 

She is requesting a loan to buy bread, which is a popular product in the area. Sandra believes that this loan will help her earn more income by providing her clients with a wider variety of products. In the future, she wants to increase the variety she offers in her business and continue working in this sector because she enjoys it, and through it she has provided for her family. Her goal is to be one of the best merchants in the community, have higher income, and be able to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy bread.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Fatmata from Kandeh town southern area in Bo. She is married with three children between the ages of six and 18 and she has five additional dependants living with her who are relatives. Fatmata's children are currently attending school. For the past 10 years, she has run a general merchandise store where she sells cement, palm oil, and gari, which is made from cassava. Fatmata works at her business 12 hours a day, six days per week and it is her only source of income. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient capital to operate her business.

Fatmata is requesting a loan to buy more stock such as cement, palm oil, and gari. The extra income from her loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and start a savings account. In the future, she plans to expand her business more. Fatmata appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy cement, palm oil, and gari

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of items such as cream, soap, toothpaste and sugar.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is 36 years old and blessed with four children. He is a wheat farmer as well as a livestock trader and has been in the business for the past three years. Kennedy makes a monthly income of 10,000 KES. 

Kennedy is requesting his third 50,000 KES loan from KADET LTD to purchase more livestock to sell and sprays for his wheat farm. He will use the anticipated profit from his loan to reinvest in his business. Kennedy's future dream is to be a large-scale farmer and improve his living standard.

loans.use: to purchase livestock to sell and sprays for his farm

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Musu from the town of Kandeh in Bo, located in the southern area of Sierra Leone. She is married with three children between the ages of 9 and 16 years, all currently attending school. She also has two relatives at home.

Musu runs a general merchandise store selling dishes, soft drinks, dresses, shoes and bags. She has been running this business for 10 years, working 10 hours per day, 7 days per week. Musu also earns income from small-scale farming in the village. She says that the main challenges to her business are transportation costs and inflation.

Musu has requested a loan of Le 5,000,000 through BRAC in order to buy more general stock such as dishes, soft drinks, dresses, shoes and bags. The extra income from this loan will allow her to renovate her rental house and educate her children. In the future, she plans to own a big house. Musu appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more general stock such as dishes, soft drinks, dresses, shoes and bags.

loans.name: Fanta

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 41-year-old Fanta from Kulanda town in Bo southern area. She is married and has 3 children between the ages 18 and 21 years. Her children attend school. 

Fanta runs a clothing business within a busy market area; she sells wax cotton, lace, material and bags. She has been running this business for 3 years. She started her business because her husband had lost his job and her children had to go to school, and so she needed money to support her family.  She works at the business 10 hours a day and 6 days a week. Her business is the only source of income for her family. Her customer base is growing, but she has insufficient capital to operate the business.

Fanta has requested a loan in order to buy more clothing material such as wax cotton, lace, material and bags. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children. In the future, she plans to run an international business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To buy more clothing material such as wax cotton, lace, material and bags.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is 29 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past two years, Jimmy has been working hard to manage his leather shop, where he sells shoes and belts. 

To help expand his business, Jimmy is requesting a 2,000,000 UGX loan to buy more shoes to add to inventory. His loan will help him generate greater profits and expand his inventory. Jimmy hopes that in the future he will be able to have a bigger business. 

Jimmy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). This program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jimmy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to add to his inventory

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a hardworking business lady with one child aged 23. She sells fruits in a busy environment to earn a living. She has been in the business for ten years. Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has improved financially because she has been trained in financial management. She hopes to operate a hardware store in five years. She needs a loan of 60,000 KES to buy more fruits for resale.

loans.use: To buy fruits

loans.name: Ndambu

texts.en: Ndambu is 28 years old. He operates a retail shop to earn a living. He has been in the business for three years and has two employees. He describes his immediate business environment to be good with reliable customers. Through Faulu Kenya, he has become business-oriented because he has been trained in business management. He hopes to grow his business in five years. He needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.use: To buy maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Gloria Angeles

texts.es:
La joven Gloria de 22 años de edad es habitante de León, actualmente estudia su universidad, ella a  pesar de su corta edad es una joven muy trabajadora, de oficio comerciante se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Inicio su actividad por iniciativa propia hace dos años ya que quería ser una persona independiente, su mama la apoya con la pulpería pues cuando Gloria va a la universidad la mama atiende a los clientes, sus productos los comercializa en su casa de habitación. Cuenta con otros ingresos ya que trabaja como domestica en la comunidad, hoy en día Gloria quiere invertir en su pulpería para poder ofrecer a sus clientes productos variados y obtener mejores ingresos.
Realiza el crédito para comprar granos básicos, arroz, huevo, aceite, azúcar, jugos, pan, leche, etc. Todos los insumos  necesarios para su pulpería, ella estima que este crédito será de ayuda ya que podrá surtir su negocio para mayor atracción de clientes, incrementaran sus ventas generando a la vez mejores ingresos, sus planes futuros es diversificar su negocio para ser una mejor comerciante, espera contar con el apoyo de Kiva para lograr sus sueños y poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Gloria is a young 22 year old woman who lives in Leon and currently studies at the university there. Despite her young age, she is a very hard-working woman and has dedicated herself to running a small grocery/general store. She began her store on her own initiative two years ago, because she wanted to be an independent person. Her mother supports Gloria with the store by helping customers and selling products at home while Gloria attends university. The store is one source of Gloria's income, as she also works as a domestic in the community. Now, Gloria would like to invest in her store to be able to offer various products to her customers and to earn a better income.

Gloria is asking for a loan to purchase basic grains, rice, eggs, oil, sugar, juice, bread, milk, etc.--all necessary items for her store. She believes that this loan will help her to better stock her store to attract more customers, increase her sales, and improve her income. Her future plans are to diversify her business to become a more successful merchant, and Gloria hopes to count on Kiva's support to achieve her dreams and continue moving forward.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, rice, eggs, oil, sugar, juice, bread, milk, etc.

loans.name: Shaban

texts.en:
Shaban is from Kosovo and lives with his wife and five children. Over the years, he has been working on a farm. Shaban began by buying a cow and now he has more cows and has expanded his farm.

Shaban is requesting a loan from KosInvest to buy another cow. He wants to increase the number of cows on his farm. Shaban hopes that his loan will help him to achieve his business goals and provide a better quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Ahmet

texts.en:
Ahmet is from Kosovo. He is married and is the father of five children. He lives in a village and the main source of income for the family is from livestock. 

Ahmet wants to expand his farm, but he lacks the necessary funds. This loan will help him and his family to purchase a cow. It is important for Ahmet to increase the number of cows and to have a chance to sell more milk and milk products and generate more income. This will help him to cover his family's costs and to ensure financial stability for them.

loans.use: To purchase a cow.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is 48 years old and married with eight children. For the past three years, she has operated a medical clinic and offers her services to customers with low incomes. Violet is also a community health worker and used a previous loan from Faulu Kenya to open her clinic. 

Violet is requesting a 25,000 KES loan to buy medicines and a microscope. In the future, she dreams of uplifting the standards of her clinic.

loans.use: to buy medicines and a microscope

loans.name: Ishabella

texts.en:
Ishabella is 37 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala East region of Uganda. She is single and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past five years, Ishabella has been working hard to manage her retail shop where she sells essential items such as sugar and flour. 

To help expand her business, Ishabella is requesting a 3,000,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to buy more sugar, soap, and other items. Her loan will help Ishabella to generate greater profits and to increase her income. She hopes that in the future she will be able to be self-reliant. 

Ishabella is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  This program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ishabella who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more sugar, soap, and other items

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is 27 years old and has two children. She operates a retail shop in a competitive environment with reliable customers. Besides that, she operates a mechanic outlet where she generates extra income. Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has improved her saving skills because she has been trained in financial management. She hopes to operate a wholesale business and became prosperous in the future. She needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy sugar, cooking oil, rice, and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking oil, rice, and maize flour.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali lives in Likoni, Kenya. He is involved in the transport industry. He was first employed in a touring company from which he saved money to purchase a van.

Ali was introduced to Milango by his friends and joined to access funding for his business. He is applying for a loan of 83,500 Kenyan shillings to purchase vehicle tires and carry out body work on his van to attract tourists.

His ambitions include owning more touring vans and finally establishing a touring company.  The additional income from this loan will help him in the future with emergency needs. He will use the extra income to purchase fuel and other operations.

loans.use: To purchase vehicle tires and carry out body work on his van.

loans.name: Jemima

texts.en:
Jemima is a 32-year-old business lady living in Mariakani, Kenya. She is married and has one child. She owns a retail shop from where she sells animal feed and fertilizer; a business which she has been doing for one year.

Besides this, Jemima has previously been in the taxi business. She had briefly stopped the transport business but has picked up once again and now has two taxis.

Jemima learnt of Milango from an employee and is requesting a loan for 83,450 Kenya shillings to buy animal feed and fertilizer. The main challenge in the business is high fuel cost and some clients not paying on time.

Her goal is to have a working capital of one million Kenya shillings in the near future and be a major transporter.

loans.use: To to buy animal feed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 44-year-old single mother of two children ages 12 and 22. She started a tailoring business six years ago and earns a monthly income of 4,000 KES.

Jane is requesting a 30,000 KES loan to purchase cloth material to tailor and sell. This will be her sixth loan. Jane will reinvest her profits back into her business. In the future, she hopes to succeed in life and expand her business to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase material to make dresses

loans.name: Nadduli

texts.en:
Nadduli is 37 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala East region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past five years, Nadduli has been working hard to manage his retail shop where he sells dresses, skirts, and sweaters. 

To help expand his business, Nadduli is requesting a 3,000,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to buy more materials. His loan will help him to generate greater profits and increase his income. Nadduli hopes that in the future he will be able to be self-reliant. 

Nadduli is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). This program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Nadduli who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase an additional motorcycle due to increase in the number of clients.

loans.name: Fanny

texts.en:
Fanny is 50 years old, single and has no children. Even though this can often be seen as a negative situation where she is from, she has demonstrated her will to prosper and work hard. Indeed, this is now the second loan Fanny takes from Edpyme Alternative with the support of Kiva, having had a good experience her first time around.

She lives in her own house, with her mother in the district of Tambogrande, Northern Peru. They do not have the basic services of  water or electricity in her community. Fanny has two main sources of income. On the one hand, she sells cosmetics which has proven a succesful idea. On the other hand, she also has a small crop of lemons, which she takes care of with the help of her nephews. She is now looking for a loan of 1,500 to keep on expanding her cosmetics business and to buy compost for her lemon plants. She proved to be a responsible client and was prompt paying her previous loan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to expand her cosmetics business and to buy compost for her lemon plants.

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.en: Roberto is an experienced moto-taxi driver, 30 years old, from a rural area called Olmos in Northern Peru. His type of work is very important to connect people with the main areas of the region. He lives in a small rural community of around 70 houses with his wife and 5-year-old child. This system provides a cheap and efficient way for people to be able to reach distant communities and provides his family with a key income stream. He is now asking for a loan of 2000 soles, which he will use to repair the tires of his motor vehicle, do general maintenance to it, as well as to sort out some leaks in his tin roof.

loans.use: repair the tires of his motor vehicle and repair some leaks in his tin roof

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en: Rosie, 37 years old, is married and lives in Militar, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines. Rosie operates a transportation business, using a trisikad (pedicab), for a living. She's been in this business for 7 years. Each month, she earns 3,500 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 4,500 PHP to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. Rosie has been a member of GDMPC since 2008. In the future, Rosie wants to make improvements to her business.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.en: Maria Rosa is 58 years old, married, with one child. They live in a small town called Morropón in Northern Peru. Within their humble house, she has set up a small shop where she sells different products like rice, vegetables, milk or sugar. She has proven her micro-entrepreneurial spirit by identifying that opportunity and taking action. As a result of the success of her shop, she feels it is time to make certain changes to it. In particular she wants to make the shop bigger and offer a wider range of products. Hence, she is taking a loan with Edpyme Alternativa and Kiva of 2513 soles (which includes transport cost incurred) to carry out this expansion. She has very good personal references within her community. This is of course no coincidence, as her hard work and ability to put into practice her ideas pay off with a good reputation.

loans.use: To increase the size of her shop and buy goods to increase the range of products on offer

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en: Perlita is a 50-year-old married mom of 2 children. She is living in Gabunon, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines, where her wide array of corn production is located. She has been cultivating this land since she was 25 years of age until the present time. She normally receives PHP 7,000 a month. In 2011, Perlita joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure to increase production. When the crop gets realized, the revenue will be allotted to expanding the business area to earn more income and to sustain her daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is married. She is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. 

Florencia is a farmer and she operates a corn production business to earn a living. She has been doing this for fifteen years and every month she earns PHP 8,000 from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase fertilizer such as manure. 

Florencia has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Mujembere Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nyota  est une veuve  courageuse. Agée  de 60 ans, mère de 5 enfants tous scolarisés;  est au 6ème cycle dans son groupe de crédit Munjembere.  Elle est vendeuse des boissons sucrées  depuis 2009 après le décès de son mari. Elle compte acheter  60 caisses des boissons sucrées avec le crédit sollicité  pour la croissance  de son affaire tout en souhaitant avoir un  dépôt  dans l’avenir. Elle remercie Hekima pour ces prêts et prie Dieu de le bénir d’avantage.
texts.en:
The client Nyota is a courageous widow. She is 60 years old, mother of five children all having attended school, and is entering her sixth loan cycle with the Munjembere credit group.

She has been selling soft drinks since 2009, following her husband's death. She plans to buy 60 cases of soft drinks with the loan she requested to expand her business, and hopes to open a store in the future.

She thanks Hekima for these loans and asks God to bless them even more.

loans.use: buy 60 cases of soft drinks

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Maria Natividad

texts.es:
María, es una persona muy emprendedora, reconocida por la comunidad, vive con sus dos hijos, de 19 y 18 años de edad, ambas estudian el bachillerato y son dependientes de ella, María es viuda se dedica a atender un negocio en la venta de comida y productos de consumo, esto lo aprendió por la necesidad económica, lo realiza con sus hijas desde hace 5 años.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos de la canasta básica, para surtir la tienda creando más oportunidades de obtener ingresos, invertirá por ejemplo en: Pastas, embutidos, boquitas, galletas, gaseosas, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, sal, que son los más comunes en los negocios, ya que cuentan con la mayor demanda. Esta inversión le proporcionara un negocio más amplio y surtido, que le ayudara a mejorar el servicio con los clientes, dándole mayores ventas,  para sus condiciones de vida tanto personales como de sus hijas, en este negocio el riesgo son las variaciones de los precios en los productos y la competencia.
El objetivo de María es seguir luchando y trabajando para mejorar sus condiciones económicas, tambien quiere apoyar a sus hijas con la alimentación debida y la educación, para que se preparen académicamente.
texts.en:
María is a very enterprising person who is recognized by her community.  She lives with her two children, who are 19 and 18 years old and who are both in high school.  They are both her dependents.  María is a widow who tends to her business selling food and food products.  She learned how to run her business due to economic need and she has been doing it for five years now with her daughters.

She is asking for a loan to buy staple products to stock her business and to create more opportunities to generate earnings. She will invest in things such as pastas, canned goods, snack foods, cookies, sodas, rice, beans, sugar, and salt, which are the most common things found in businesses like hers because they are the most in demand.  This investment will make her business bigger and better stocked, which will help her improve the service she offers her customers.  This will make more sales for her that will help with the quality of life of both her and her daughters.  The risks in her business are the fluctuation of the prices of her products and the competition.

María's goal is to keep fighting and working to improver her financial situation.  She also wants to support her daughters with good nutrition and an education so they have the academic training they need.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snack foods, cookies, sodas, rice, beans, rice, and salt

loans.name: Esenbol

texts.en: Esenbol, 28, lives with his wife and his two children in a small house he owns in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. His wife studies at a vocational training center. His children are kindergarten students. He owns an old Russian car. He was assistant driver to carry baggage after finishing his driving school in 2009. His salary makes the household income. The income he generates from his work is not sufficient for him to provide for the family. So, he wants to buy a truck that saves fuel to start his own transportation business. He is a hardworking and clever man. He is requesting 3,500,000 MNT to purchase a truck that saves fuel to carry baggage.

loans.use: To purchase a truck that saves fuel to carry baggage

loans.name: Ayub

texts.en: Ayub is a 27-year-old man who is married to Selmi, 27 years old. They are blessed with 2 children, Geraldit, 2 years old, and Elisda, 4 months old. Ayub works as a farmer. On the farm, he is planting cabbage and corn this season. Ayub spends 9 hours a day on his farm to take care of the plants by watering the plants, mowing the grass, spreading the fertilizer, etc. Ayub intends to buy more seedling, fertilizer and a water hose to ease his job in watering the plants. Therefore, Ayub is requesting a loan from TLM in the amount of IDR 5,000,000 to purchase these items.

loans.use: to buy more seedling, fertilizer, and a water hose

loans.name: Eraldo Ovando

texts.es:
Eraldo, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo con la intención de mejorar el negocio invirtiendo en la compra de medicamentos en variedad de presentaciones y para diferentes enfermedades o padecimientos, también quiere comprarse variedad de ropa en blusas y faldas ropa interior para salir a vender, pues esto le ayudará a tener un negocio surtido y poder continuar trabajando por su familia.
Con el préstamo anterior le permitió crecer teniendo lo necesario a su alcance, dándole continuidad a su trabajo y hasta el momento ha logrado mantener a su familia en buenas condiciones a través de los préstamos.
texts.en:
Eraldo is requesting a new loan with the intention of improving his business by investing in the purchase of medications in a variety of forms and for different sicknesses or ailments. He also wants to buy a variety of clothing including blouses, skirts and undergarments to sell. This will help him to have a stocked business and be able to continue working to support his family. 

With the previous loan he was able to grow having all that was necessary at his reach, allowing him to continue his work and up to this moment having succeeded in keeping his family in good condition through these loans.

loans.use: to buy medicine, skirts and blouses to sell.

loans.name: Maria Delmy

texts.es:
María, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo por qué quiere invertir en el negocio, aumentando el inventario de la tienda que ha instalado, ya que esto le permite un mejor servicio a sus clientes y mantener su preferencia, se comprará azúcar, aceite, pastas, boquitas, jabón y detergentes, entre otros productos que son demandados por los clientes por su uso diario en el lugar.
Con el préstamo anterior logró incrementar los materiales para elaborar tortillas, esto le ha ocasionado un mejor funcionamiento con sus clientes, ya que sus ventas han sido buenas, su negocio está cambiando volviéndose más rentable, ya que tiene establecida una tienda, venta de bebidas y las tortillas, gracias al crédito de kiva considera que está prosperando con su familia.
texts.en:
María is asking for a new loan because she wants to invest in her business by bolstering the inventory of the store she set up.  This will allow her to offer her customers better service and it will allow her to keep what they want in stock.  She will buy sugar, oil, pastas, snack foods, soap, and detergents, among other products her customers demand for their daily use.

With her previous loan, she was able to get more supplies to make tortillas, which has allowed them to better serve their customers.  As their sales have been good, her business has been changing and becoming more successful now that she has set up a storefront where she sells drinks and tortillas.  She believes that it is because of the Kiva loan that she and her family are prospering.

loans.use: to buy sugar, pastas, snack foods, soap, and detergents

loans.name: Marthen

texts.en:
Marthen (50) is married to Nurlin (39) and they are blessed with 4 children, Olmi (15), Viran (11), Yakob (9) and Retwi (5). All are attending school. 
Marthen has been running a kiosk business for more than 11 years. It is adjacent to his house. He sells household items like bath soap, detergent, biscuits, cigarettes, soft drinks, and cakes. Due to the increase in his children's schooling expenses, Marthen is thinking of improving his business in order to generate more income by selling rice in bulk. Therefore, he is requesting a loan in the amount of IDR 10,000,000 from TLM.

loans.use: to purchase rice in bulk to be resold

loans.name: Maimuna

texts.en:
Maimuna is a 34-year-old widow. She has three children. Abdul, 17, is in the 3rd grade of junior high school; Jefriyanto, 16, is in the 2nd grade of senior high school; Firanti, 13, is in the 1st grade of junior high school. 
Maimuna is a hardworking woman. Since the death of her husband several years ago, she strives to better cover her family’s living cost. In the morning, she sells vegetables at the market and after that, she continues to run the kiosk business at home. Maimuna admitted that she needs extra capital to stock the kiosk with more products and one of her neighbors suggested that she borrow the money from TLM. She is happy to request a loan of IDR 3,000,000. She would like to use the loan to purchase coffee, milk, tea, eggs, soap, shampoo, detergent, snacks, instant noodles, and fresh drink.

loans.use: to buy more coffee, milk, tea, eggs, soap, shampoo, detergent, snacks, instant noodles, and fresh drinks for her kiosk.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, ya que considera que son muchas las facilidades de crecimiento que obtiene a través de él, está en el proceso agrícola y para esto deberá invertir en abonos e insecticidas, ya que iniciará la siembra en una manzana de terreno, también deberá preparar las hortalizas, considera que a través de estos préstamos está logrando obtener buenos resultados.
Con el crédito anterior tuvo un incremento en sus cosechas debido a la inversión realizada, con materiales que aplica al momento de la siembra, esto le generó ganancias por la venta de la cosecha ayudando a su familia a mejorar sus condiciones haciéndolas más favorables.
texts.en:
Rafael is asking for a new loan, as he believes that it will offer him many opportunities for growth.  He works in farming and so he has to invest in fertilizers and insecticides, as he will start planting a plot of land.  He also has to prepare his produce.  He believes that he is getting good results through the use of these loans.

With his last loan his yield increased because of the investment he made in supplies that are used at the time of planting.  This generated earnings for him through sales of his produce, which helped to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Sharif

texts.en:
Sharif is 33 years old and lives in the town of Mbale, Uganda. He is married and has two children of which one is currently in school. For the past five years, Sharif has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells clothes. 

To help expand his business, Sharif has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase his sales, and will help Sharif generate greater profits. Sharif hopes to become the richest man in the village in the future. 

Sharif is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sharif who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too big for microloans.

loans.use: to increase his clothing sales.

loans.name: Lexy

texts.en:
Lexy is a 20-year-old single man who is living with his parents and his 10-year-old sister. After graduating from high school one year ago, Lexy decided to start a kiosk business. As the oldest son, Lexy is responsible to support his parents in generating income for their daily needs. He spent his own money to buy kiosk stock. He sells daily-use basic items e.g., instant noodle, biscuits, sugar, coffee, shampoo, etc.
 
Lately, Lexy has been thinking of adding more stock to his kiosk such as cigarettes, instant noodles, snacks, and cooking oil and he also wants to sell petrol and mobile phone recharge. He needs capital assistance to do so. Lexy then met a loan officer and received some information about the TLM lending program. He is interested in joining TLM and requested a loan of IDR 5,000,000 to implement his plan.

loans.use: to add more kiosk stock and to buy petrol and mobile phone recharge

loans.name: Jessica Paulina

texts.es:
JESSICA PAULINA tiene 27 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.

JESSICA PAULINA es administrador en un cyber. Solicita el crédito para comprar un computador, impresora. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar el computador para digitar los trabajos que hace. La compra la efectuará en la ciudad de Guaranda.

El sueño es poder salir del país para conocer otro ambiente. En el tiempo libre le gusta escuchar música y leer.
texts.en:
Jessica Paulina is 27 years old, she is single and she has no children. She lives with her parents in Guaranda, in the Bolivar province.

Jessica Paulina is the manager of an Internet café. She is requesting a loan to buy a computer and a printer.

Thanks to the loan she will be able to buy a computer to organize the things she does. She will buy it in the town of Guaranda.

She dreams of going out of her country to visit new places. In her free time she very much likes listening to music and reading.

loans.use: To buy a computer and a printer.

loans.name: Sara Noemi

texts.es:
SARA NOEMI tiene 52 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene 2 hijos, vive con el conyugue, hijos en Guaranda provincia de Bolívra.

SARA NOEMI presta sus servicios en una institución cómo auxiliar. Solicita el crédito para pago de matrícula y comprar una lapto. Con la ayuda del crédito podra ayudar al hijo a pagar la matrícula de la universidad y comprar el computador.

La compra lo hara en Guaranda y el pago de la matrícula lo hará en Quito. El sueño es poder tener la posibilidad de terminar la casa y ver a los hijos profesionales.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es conservar el trabajo. En el tiempo libre le gusta leer y compartir momentos de juego y diverción con los hijos.
texts.en:
Sara Noemi is 52 years old, she lives in a common-law marriage and she has 2 children. She lives with her partner and their children in Guaranda, in the Bolivar province.

Sara Noemi works as an assistant in an institution. She is requesting a loan to pay registration fees and to buy a laptop. Thanks to the loan she will be able to help her son with the payment of his university registration fees and to buy a computer.

She will buy the computer in Guaranda, while she will pay registration fees in Quito. She dreams of succeeding in finishing building her house and to see her children become professionals.

The challenge she has to face is keeping her job. In her free time she likes Reading and sharing games and funny moments with her children.

loans.use: To pay registration fees and to buy a laptop.

loans.name: Im's Group

texts.en:
Im is 42 years old and lives in one of the remote areas of the Kandal province.  She is the mother of four children.  One of her children works at the garment factory, another two run a tiny grocery store and the fourth still attends school. 

Her primary source of income to support this entire family is her mat weaving business.  She has been in business for 10 years and can earn about 13,000 KHR per day.  This is Im's fourth loan cycle with KIVA's partner, VisionFund.  She has successfully repaid her past three loans in full.  The previous loans have enabled her to improve her living conditions and she is able to manage both the daily expenses and keep her children in school.  

Now she has formed a group with another member to apply for a loan.  As the group leader, she will use her portion of the loan to buy the reed necessary for weaving mats.  She hopes to produce a lot of mats so as to generate more income for the sake of her family.

loans.use: to buy the reed necessary for weaving mats.

loans.name: Tilek

texts.en:
Tilek, 28, lives with his wife and his two children in a small house on the land he owns in Bayanulgii province, Mongolia. His two children are kindergarten students. He runs a handicraft business making Dombor (kazakh traditional musical instrument). His wife helps with his business. He is well known to the locals. His business is sustainable and has many regular customers and suppliers. The income he generates from his business is enough for his family. 

He wants to build a garden on the land he owns. He also wants to expand his business. He is a hardworking and clever man. He says "I want to build my own factory by expanding my business"  He is requesting 4,000,000 MNT to buy some trees, lawn and flower seeds to make a garden.

loans.use: To buy some trees, lawn and flower seeds.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Josie is selling Tupperware in their local community. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy more Tupperware to resell.

Josie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Josie hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of tupperware to resell.

loans.name: Tania

texts.es:
La señora Tania es socia del banco comunal “Fruto Bendito”, del Distrito Manantay, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 35 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene tres hijos.
Son tres años que viene trabajando con Manuela Ramos, tiene un moto car con el cual brinda servicio de taxi, su hijo es el que lo maneja por las mañanas antes de ir al colegio.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: un juego de llantas, 2 cámaras y aceite.
Su esposo es trabajador independiente y es el encargado de pagar todos los gastos de su hogar, el ingreso de su movilidad es un extra para la casa con él se cubren algunos gastos imprevistos y felizmente tiene la ayuda de uno de sus hijos.
Espera que toda las socias de su banco paguen puntualmente para que puedan seguir trabajando sin ningún problema, está muy agradecida con Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Sra. Tania is a member of the Communal Bank “Fruto Bendito”, which is located in the District of Manantay in the Department of Ucayali. She is 35 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has three children.

Tania has been working with Manuela Ramos for three years. She has a motorcycle taxi that she uses for providing transportation services. Her son drives the vehicle in the mornings before he goes to school. With her new loan of 1,000 PEN, Tania will buy a set of tires, two inner tubes, and oil.

Her husband is a self-employed worker and is in charge of paying for all of the household expenses. The income from her taxi service provides extra household income for unforeseen expenses. Fortunately she has help from one of her children.

Tania hopes that all of the members of her Communal Bank pay on time so that they can continue working without any problems. She is extremely grateful to Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: to buy a set of tires, two inner tubes, and oil.

loans.name: Aida Beatriz

texts.es:
AIDA BEATRIZ tiene 47 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene 2 hijos, vive con el esposo y los hijos en casa de unos familiares en Guaranda provincia de Bolivar.

AIDA BEATRIZ es asistente de limpieza, Solicita el crédito para comprar medicina y pago de consulta. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar la medicina. 

La compra lo hará en una farmacia de Guaranda. El sueño es poder tener salud, estabilidad laboral y ayudar a la familia.

El desafío al que se enfrenta es salir adelante en el trabajo. En el tiempo libre le gusta tejer y compartir momentos agradables con la familia.
texts.en:
Aida Beatriz is 47 years old, she lives in a common-law marriage and she has 2 children. She lives with her partner and their children in the house of a relative in Guaranda, in the Bolivar province.

Aida Beatriz is an assistant cleaner. She is requesting a loan to buy medicines and to pay for medical consultation. Thanks to the loan she will be able to buy the medicines she needs.

She will buy the medicines in a pharmacy of Guaranda. She wishes to enjoy good health, to have working stability and to her her family.

The challenge she has to face is to progress with her job. In her free time she likes weaving and to share pleasant moments with her family.

loans.use: To buy medicines and to pay for medical consultation.

loans.name: Noost

texts.en:
Noost, 56, lives with his wife and his two children in a small house he owns in Uvs province, Mongolia. His wife is retired. His daughter is a college teacher. Also he works as a college teacher. He wants to run an agriculture business with his son. 

Last year, he bought 1,5 hectares of land. He is planning to plant some organic vegetables on the land. He is a humble and diligent man. He says " I want to improve my family's livelihood by planting vegetables."  He is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy organic vegetable seeds for his new business.

loans.use: To buy organic vegetable seeds for his new business.

loans.name: Jescel

texts.en:
Jescel is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 8 children. 
Jescel sells snacks in her community. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks, like flour, sugar, and cheese.
Jescel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients in making snacks

loans.name: Nary

texts.en:
Nary is 31 years old and lives in Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal Province. As the breadwinner of the family of two kids who are still in school, she has been farming on one hectare of farmland as her main income for nine years and working in a factory as additional income for six years. She can earn about 10 US Dollars per day, but she is able to save about 4 US Dollars. 

This is the first loan for Nary with VisionFund and she is requesting a loan of 1,000 US dollars to buy fertilizers, seeds, and a cow for her farmland. She hopes to grow healthy quantities of rice and earn more profits so that she can keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and a cow for her farmland.

loans.name: Keziah

texts.en:
Thirty-year-old Kesiah is married and blessed with three children aged 13, five and three years. She cooks and sells food, a business she started seven years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 25,000. 

She has requested for a first loan of KES 30,000 to purchase more utensils and a Meko gas for efficient services. 

The profit earned from the business will help her repay her loan and support her family’s needs. Her dream is to educate her children as well as lead a better life.

loans.use: To puchase more utensils to serve her customers and a meko gas for efficient cooking.

loans.name: Kasao

texts.en:
Kasao is 37 years old and married. He supports a family of eight children. He is a maize farmer and has been in this business for the last 10 years with a monthly income of KES 5,000. 

He is servicing his 4th loan of KES 40,000 from KADET and this will facilitate him in preparing the farm and purchasing inputs. He hopes to use the anticipated profits to expand his farm and reinvest. His future dreams is to improve the family's living standards and educate his children.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Chona has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Chona became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, Chona hopes to improve her business for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap and beverages.

loans.name: Manuel Mesias

texts.es:
Manuel Mesías tiene 30 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con la madre y los familiares en san Miguel Provincia de bolívar.

Es integrante de la VRC PATRON SAN MIGUEL se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Paila Loma Cantón San Miguel, a una distancia de 40 minutos a la oficina de la Cooperativa San José Agencia Chillanes, los socios se dedican a la agricultura y crianza de animales.

Manuel Mesías se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, papas, mora, arveja además se dedica a la cría de ganado, cerdos, pollos y tiene un taller de carpintería.

Solicita el crédito para compra de insumos para los cultivos además de fertilizantes, abonos y comprar madera, cortadora. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes.

Las compras lo hará en San Pablo. El sueño es poder comprar terreno, tener casa propia. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es el mal tiempo ocasionando pérdidas. En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte y salir a pasear.
texts.en:
Manuel Mesías is 30 years old, single, and has no children. He lives with his mother and other relatives in San Miguel, which is in Bolívar Province.

Manuel is a member of the Communal Bank “Patron San Miguel”, which is located in the community of Paila Loma in the canton of San Miguel. This community is 40 minutes away from the Chillanes branch office of Cooperativa San José. The members of this Communal Bank engage in agriculture and livestock breeding.

Manuel Mesías is a farmer who grows corn, beans, potatoes, blackberries, and peas. He also raises cattle, pigs, and chickens. Manuel also manages a carpentry workshop. He is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies for his crops, such as fertilizers and compost. Manuel will also buy wood and a saw. He will be able to buy fertilizers with the help of this loan. His purchases will be made in San Pablo.

Manuel dreams are to buy a plot of land and to own a house. The challenges he faces include dealing with bad weather and occasional losses.

In his free time, Manuel enjoys practicing sports and going out for walks.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, wood, and a saw.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
